revised_title: Diurnal Inequalities of Terrestrial Magnetism: A Study of Observations from 1841 to 1857
tldr: This paper presents the diurnal inequalities of terrestrial magnetism observed at the Royal Observatory, Greenwich, from 1841 to 1857. The author analyzes the data from various magnetometers and describes the changes in declination, horizontal force, and vertical force over time. The findings reveal a significant change in the magnetism during the period 1848-1857, suggesting a possible connection to the Earth's interaction with the Sun.
